intro: Cynanchica stricta subsp. stricta, commonly known as the strict milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and covered in a dense layer of soft, white pubescence. The plant is adapted to dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
